item.title: Bins on the pavement, 22nd December
item.description:
These bins have been on the pavement since February 2025. Have reported this many times and nothing seems to have been done. As you can see when I leave for work in the mornings you can't see them. Is it okay for some people to leave them out and not others

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Lane, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicles can't pass safely, 22nd December
item.description:
There is a wall along this whole stretch of Lower Station Road. It, and the double yellow lines, are almost completely obscured by overhanging vegetation. If this was cleared then two cars could easily pass each other which would alleviate the congestion which occurs daily at peak times especially.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Station Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping - bed, carpet, furniture, 22nd December
item.description:
There was some stuff there already but the pile grew over the weekend. You can’t see it but our food recycle bin is at the back of that and you have to literally step over it all. Impossible to reach for anyone not very mobile

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture and Shopping Carts Dumped, 22nd December
item.description:
Several pieces of furniture were left on the kerb about two weeks ago. The photo is of the remaining furniture. In addition, across the road, two shopping carts have been abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Mews, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation narrowing road width, 22nd December
item.description:
You can see how much of road width has gone by the obscured KEEP CLEAR marking and lack of yellow lines. The big problem is when a van is parked in the last parking space it is very difficult to see oncoming cars when turning out of Heathlee Road. Because of the reduced road width you need to stop almost immediately to avoid blocking the oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Station Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inoperative ‘Belisha Beacon’ on the northern pavement (pole F9) at the zebra-crossing on Salter Road, 50 metres east of Rotherhithe Street., 22nd December
item.description:
Inoperative ‘Belisha Beacon’ on the northern pavement (pole F9) at the zebra-crossing on Salter Road, 50 metres east of Rotherhithe Street. The beacon is incorporated into the lighting column so there may be a general power outage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salter Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of leaves halfway up Point Hill on west side, 22nd December
item.description:
Some community-spirited soul has swept into a heap the fallen leaves in the gutter on the west side of Point Hill. Would it be possible to collect this 'leaf-tipping' before motorists seeking to park in this area disperse these leaves again?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Point Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slab loose, tipping freely with no cement to hold it, 22nd December
item.description:
This is an extreme trip hazard, being raised an inch or two from its neighbouring slabs, but with a lot more movement when stepped on. It is outside number 18 Arlington, and could cause very serious injury such as broken hip etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Arlington, Woodside Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pole supporting the ‘Give Way’ sign on Rotherhithe Street, westbound, at its junction with Salter Road, has been severely knocked., 22nd December
item.description:
The pole supporting the ‘Give Way’ sign has been severely knocked and is currently precariously leaning 45° into the carriageway. Aside from the risk of being struck by a passing vehicle or cyclist, as can be seen, it has a live electrical connection, compounding the danger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaner needed at East Bank, 22nd December
item.description:
The road needs cleaning. Residents have reported this multiple times. There's excessive litter and leaves on both sides of the road. Previous report was marked as resolved when the street has not been cleaned. Please attend
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): East Bank, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
